definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: In his dining room, a self-made horse head string instrument caught my attention.
sentences.chinese: 飯廳裏，一把自制的馬頭琴引起了我的注意。

sentences.english: Is there a solo of that fiddle?
sentences.chinese: 今天有沒有馬頭琴獨奏？

sentences.english: Seated on the ground are a group of young men playing horse-headed fiddles.
sentences.chinese: 坐在地上的是一些拉馬頭琴的年輕人。

sentences.english: That's the horse-head fiddle of the Mongolian nationality. Its music is rather moving.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族的馬頭琴，用它演奏的音樂非常感人。

definition: double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
The Drunken Beauty, Qing Dynasty Beijing opera
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
